update.description:
This tutorial gives instructions for configuring the sundry devices, cables and computers in the HAPTIX setup.

http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=haptix_unboxing&cat=haptix&branch=haptix_unboxing_tutorial
update.title: HAPTIX hardware setup tutorial

content.raw: Not sure about this part `...but most Haptix teams are more comfortable and familiar with Windows`.
content.html: Not sure about this part ...but most Haptix teams are more comfortable and familiar with Windows.

content.raw: Note that I renamed the launchers to be: haptixStart, haptixUpdate and haptixSupport.  We should update `desktop.png`.
content.html: Note that I renamed the launchers to be: haptixStart, haptixUpdate and haptixSupport. We should update desktop.png.

content.raw: Start with one hash, otherwise the table of contents won't work properly.
content.html: Start with one hash, otherwise the table of contents won't work properly.

content.raw:
Would the following work?

~~~
sudo service spacenavd restart
~~~
content.html:
Would the following work?

sudo service spacenavd restart

content.raw: change your timezone by _clicking_ on the time
content.html: change your timezone by clicking on the time

content.raw: optionally, connect the 2-port hub to it's power adapter
content.html: optionally, connect the 2-port hub to it's power adapter

content.raw:
also:

to a USB port _in_ the Linux computer
content.html:
also:

to a USB port in the Linux computer

content.raw: It might matter, if the windows machine doesn't have DisplayPort
content.html: It might matter, if the windows machine doesn't have DisplayPort
